intro: Tinus grisebachiana, commonly known as the Grisebach's tinus, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Acanthaceae family. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, particularly in South Africa's coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
